00049 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00050 void CKCU_Configuration(void);
00051 void USB_Configuration(void);
00052 void USBPLL_Configuration(void);
00053 void USBVRG_Configuration(void);
00054 void Suspend(u32 uPara);
00055 
00056 /* Global variables ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00057 __ALIGN4 USBDCore_TypeDef gUSBCore;
00058 USBD_Driver_TypeDef gUSBDriver;
00059 u32 gIsLowPowerAllowed = TRUE;
00060 
00061 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00062 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00063   * @brief  Main program.
00064   * @retval None
00065   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00066 int main(void)
00067 {
00068   CKCU_Configuration();               /* System Related configuration                                       */
00069   RETARGET_Configuration();           /* Retarget Related configuration                                     */
00070 
00071   HT32F_DVB_PBInit(BUTTON_WAKEUP, BUTTON_MODE_EXTI);
00072   HT32F_DVB_PBInit(BUTTON_KEY1, BUTTON_MODE_EXTI);
00073   HT32F_DVB_PBInit(BUTTON_KEY2, BUTTON_MODE_EXTI);
00074 
00075   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED1);
00076   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED2);
00077   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED3);
00078 
00079   USB_Configuration();                /* USB Related configuration                                          */
00080 
00081   HT32F_DVB_USBConnect();
00082 
00083   while (1)
00084   {
00085     USBDCore_MainRoutine(&gUSBCore);  /* USB core main routine                                              */
00086   }
00087 }
00088 
00089 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00090   * @brief  Key Process.
00091   * @retval None
00092   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00093 void Key_Process(u32 EXTI_CHANNEL_n)
00094 {
00095   extern vu32 gKeyStatus[];
00096 
00097   switch (EXTI_CHANNEL_n)
00098   {
00099     case WAKEUP_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL:
00100     {
00101       gKeyStatus[HID_KEY_NUMLOCK] = 1;
00102       EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(EXTI_CHANNEL_n);
00103       break;
00104     }
00105     case KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL:
00106     {
00107       gKeyStatus[HID_KEY_CAPSLOCK] = 1;
00108       EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(EXTI_CHANNEL_n);
00109       break;
00110     }
00111     case KEY2_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL:
00112     {
00113       gKeyStatus[HID_KEY_SCROLLLOCK] = 1;
00114       EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(EXTI_CHANNEL_n);
00115       break;
00116     }
00117   }
00118 }
00119 
00120 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00121   * @brief  Configure the system clocks.
00122   * @retval None
00123   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00124 void CKCU_Configuration(void)
00125 {
00126 #if 1
00127   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00128   CKCUClock.Bit.USBD       = 1;
00129   CKCUClock.Bit.EXTI       = 1;
00130   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00131 #endif
00132 }
00133 
00134 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00135   * @brief  Configure USB.
00136   * @retval None
00137   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00138 void USB_Configuration(void)
00139 {
00140   #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00141   USBPLL_Configuration();
00142   #endif
00143 
00144   #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00145   USBVRG_Configuration();                               /* Voltage of USB setting                           */
00146   #endif
00147 
00148   gUSBCore.pDriver = (u32 *)&gUSBDriver;                /* Initiate memory pointer of USB driver            */
00149   gUSBCore.Power.CallBack_Suspend.func  = Suspend;      /* Install suspend call back function into USB core */
00150   //gUSBCore.Power.CallBack_Suspend.uPara = (u32)NULL;
00151 
00152   USBDDesc_Init(&gUSBCore.Device.Desc);                 /* Initiate memory pointer of descriptor            */
00153   USBDClass_Init(&gUSBCore.Class);                      /* Initiate USB Class layer                         */
00154   USBDCore_Init(&gUSBCore);                             /* Initiate USB Core layer                          */
00155 
00156   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00157      Must turn on if the USB clock source is from HSI (PLL clock Source)
00158   */
00159   #if 0
00160   { /* Turn on HSI auto trim function                                                                       */
00161     CKCU_HSIAutoTrimClkConfig(CKCU_ATC_USB);
00162     CKCU_HSIAutoTrimCmd(ENABLE);
00163   }
00164   #endif
00165 
00166   NVIC_EnableIRQ(USB_IRQn);                             /* Enable USB device interrupt                      */
00167 }
00168 
00169 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00170 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00171  * @brief  Configure USB PLL
00172  * @retval None
00173  ************************************************************************************************************/
00174 void USBPLL_Configuration(void)
00175 {
00176   { /* USB PLL configuration                                                                                */
00177 
00178     /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00179        Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00180        Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00181     */
00182     CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef PLLInit;
00183 
00184     PLLInit.ClockSource = CKCU_PLLSRC_HSE;  // CKCU_PLLSRC_HSE or CKCU_PLLSRC_HSI
00185     #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL_96M)
00186     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_96M;
00187     #else
00188     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_48M;
00189     #endif
00190     PLLInit.BYPASSCmd = DISABLE;
00191     CKCU_USBPLLInit(&PLLInit);
00192   }
00193 
00194   CKCU_USBPLLCmd(ENABLE);
00195 
00196   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_USBPLLRDY) == RESET);
00197   CKCU_USBClockConfig(CKCU_CKUSBPLL);
00198 }
00199 #endif
00200 
00201 #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00202 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00203  * @brief  Configure USB Voltage
00204  * @retval None
00205  ************************************************************************************************************/
00206 void USBVRG_Configuration(void)
00207 {
00208   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00209   CKCUClock.Bit.BKP                   = 1;
00210   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00211 
00212   PWRCU_SetVREG(PWRCU_VREG_3V3);
00213 
00214   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00215      USB LDO should be enabled (PWRCU_VREG_ENABLE) if the MCU VDD > 3.6 V.
00216   */
00217   PWRCU_VREGConfig(PWRCU_VREG_BYPASS);
00218 }
00219 #endif
00220 
00221 #define REMOTE_WAKEUP      (1)
00222 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00223   * @brief  Suspend call back function which enter DeepSleep1
00224   * @param  uPara: Parameter for Call back function
00225   * @retval None
00226   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00227 void Suspend(u32 uPara)
00228 {
00229   #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00230   u32 IsRemoteWakeupAllowed;
00231   #endif
00232 
00233   if (gIsLowPowerAllowed)
00234   {
00235 
00236     #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00237     /* Disable EXTI interrupt to prevent interrupt occurred after wakeup                                    */
00238     EXTI_IntConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, DISABLE);
00239     IsRemoteWakeupAllowed = USBDCore_GetRemoteWakeUpFeature(&gUSBCore);
00240 
00241     if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE)
00242     {
00243       /* Enable EXTI wake event and clear wakeup flag                                                       */
00244       EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, ENABLE);
00245       EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00246     }
00247     #endif
00248 
00249     __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld >DEEPSLEEP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00250 
00251     // Add your procedure here which disable related IO to reduce power consumption
00252     // ..................
00253     //
00254 
00255     if ((gUSBCore.Info.CurrentStatus == USB_STATE_SUSPENDED) && ((HT_USB->CSR & 0xC0) == 0x40))   // D+ = 1, D- = 0
00256     {
00257       /* For Bus powered device, you must enter DeepSleep1 when device has been suspended. For self-powered */
00258       /* device, you may decide to enter DeepSleep1 or not depended on your application.                    */
00259 
00260       /* For the convenient during debugging and evaluation stage, the USBDCore_LowPower() is map to a null */
00261       /* function by default. In the real product, you must map this function to the low power function of  */
00262       /* firmware library by setting USBDCORE_ENABLE_LOW_POWER as 1 (in the ht32fxxxx_usbdconf.h file).     */
00263       USBDCore_LowPower();
00264     }
00265 
00266     // Add your procedure here which recovery related IO for application
00267     // ..................
00268     //
00269 
00270     __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld <DEEPSLEEP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00271 
00272     #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00273     if (EXTI_GetWakeupFlagStatus(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL) == SET)
00274     {
00275       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld WAKEUP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00276       if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE && USBDCore_IsSuspend(&gUSBCore) == TRUE)
00277       {
00278         USBDCore_TriggerRemoteWakeup();
00279       }
00280     }
00281 
00282     if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE)
00283     {
00284       /* Disable EXTI wake event and clear wakeup flag                                                      */
00285       EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, DISABLE);
00286       EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00287     }
00288 
00289     /* Clear EXTI edge flag and enable EXTI interrupt                                                       */
00290     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00291     EXTI_IntConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, ENABLE);
00292     #endif
00293   }
00294 
00295   return;
00296 }

00298 #if (HT32_LIB_DEBUG == 1)
00299 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00300   * @brief  Report both the error name of the source file and the source line number.
00301   * @param  filename: pointer to the source file name.
00302   * @param  uline: error line source number.
00303   * @retval None
00304   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00305 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)
00306 {
00307   /*
00308      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
00309      Debug message can be added here.
00310      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00311   */
00312 
00313   while (1)
00314   {
00315   }
00316 }
00317 #endif
